name: common_names
description: local, non-scientific name

name: url
description: link to plant profile page (usually Wikipedia); if localized page not available, an English one is provided

name: description
description: short description from Wikipedia

name: taxonomy
description: scientific taxonomy

name: name_authority
description: scientific name of the plant and authority, for example, Taraxacum officinale F.H.Wigg.

name: rank
description: taxonomic rank

name: gbif_id
description: id in GBIF database

name: inaturalist_id
description: id in iNaturalist database

name: image
description: url of representative image

name: images
description: list of more urls of representative images

name: synonyms
description: other names of the plant

name: edible_parts
description: edible/medicinal parts of the plant

name: propagation_methods
description: propagation methods of the plant (eg. seeds, cuttings...)

name: watering
description: minimum and maximum of how wet environment the plant prefers (1 = dry, 2 = medium, 3 = wet), eg. "watering": {"min": 1, "max": 2} means plant prefers dry to medium environment

name: best_watering
description: short paragraph on optimal watering practices

name: best_light_condition
description: short paragraph on optimal lighting

name: best_soil_type
description: short paragraph on optimal soil types for growing the plant

name: common_uses
description: short paragraph on how the plant can be used

name: toxicity
description: short paragraph on whether the plant is poisonous to humans or animals

name: cultural_significance
description: short paragraph on the importance of the plant in human culture
